description:
Socure is the leading platform for digital identity verification and trust. Its predictive analytics platform applies artificial intelligence and machine learning techniques with trusted online/offline data intelligence from email, phone, address, IP, device, velocity, and the broader internet to verify identities in real time. The company has more than 2,000 customers across the financial services, government, gaming, healthcare, telecom, and e-commerce industries, including four of the top five banks, seven of the top 10 card issuers, three of the top MSBs, the top payroll provider, the top credit bureau, the top online gaming operator, the top Buy Now, Pay Later (BNPL) providers, and over 250 of the largest fintechs. Marquee customers include Chime, SoFi, Varo, Robinhood, Public, Stash, Gusto, and DraftKings. Socure customers have become investors in the company including Citi Ventures, Capital One Ventures, MVB Bank, and Synchrony. Additional investors include Accel, T. Rowe Price, Bain Capital Ventures, Tiger Global, Commerce Ventures, Scale Venture Partners, Sorenson, Flint Capital, Two Sigma Ventures, and others.

Socure has received numerous industry awards and accolades, including named to the 2021 & 2022 Forbes Cloud 100 List, Forbesâ€™ Fintech 50 List 2021, and Forbesâ€™ Americaâ€™s Best Startup Employers 2021, being named to CB Insights: The Fintech 250 for the third year in a row, being awarded Best New Technology Introduced Over the Last 12 Monthsâ€”Data and Data Services at the 2020 American Financial Technology Awards (AFTAs), being ranked number 70 in Deloitteâ€™s Technology Fast 500â„¢, being listed as a Gartner Cool Vendor, being recognized by Forbes as one of the Top 25 Machine Learning Startups to Watch, being awarded Finovateâ€™s Award for Best Use of AI/ML, to name a few. Founder/CEO Johnny Ayers has also been recognized by Goldman Sachs as one of the 100 Most Intriguing Entrepreneurs of 2021 and as an EY Entrepreneur of the Year 2022.

Launching a secure, branded onboarding experience should not require a full development cycle. Yet most teams still spend weeks building and maintaining identity verification interfaces, balancing accessibility, compliance, and conversion with limited engineering bandwidth.

Socure Hosted Flows changes that. It provides a fully hosted, no-code identity verification experience that allows organizations to deploy consistent, compliant, and conversion-optimized onboarding journeys in hours rather than weeks.

Built on Socureâ€™s RiskOS platform, Hosted Flows combines templated verification paths with global brand controls, responsive design, and preconfigured compliance and accessibility. Every session is enriched with Socure Digital Intelligence, enabling real-time behavioral and device risk assessment without additional integration effort.

Hosted Flows also supports native step-up to OTP and DocV within the same orchestration, maintaining a seamless experience for users and administrators alike. Funnel analytics and A/B testing deliver clear visibility into user drop-offs and optimization opportunities, turning onboarding into a continuously improving system rather than a static interface.

In a market where every click carries risk and every second shapes trust, Hosted Flows unites speed, compliance, and conversion in one unified experience powered by the Socure Identity Graph and RiskOS orchestration.

Age assurance is emerging as the defining trust challenge for AI platforms, with teen safety shifting from a principle to a daily operating requirement. 

The pressure is mounting from regulators, parents, and society at large: platforms must safeguard minors, yet every safeguard raises new questions of privacy, autonomy, and access.

Leading teams are testing behavior-based age estimation, routing uncertain sessions into youth-appropriate experiences, and expanding guardian controls such as curfews and crisis support, which exposes where privacy, access, and protection collide in practice. Inference alone falls short when accuracy and accountability matter, and the path forward requires precision calibrated to risk with friction that adults will accept.

The practical challenge is to verify age with precision while preserving a seamless experience  for adults, and to do so in ways that adapt across jurisdictions, regulatory frameworks, and evolving risks. Static gates and blanket document checks create unnecessary drop-off, invite workarounds, and struggle to stay current with evolving rules. Risk-graded workflows that escalate only when signals or law warrant it are now table stakes.

Socure solves these pain points with an orchestration platform designed for flexibility, scalability, and accuracy. Face-free options validate age through barcode extraction, phone and email risk intelligence, and passive data checks, confirming legitimate adults quickly while preventing underage access. For higher-stakes interactions, document analysis pairs with biometric matching and liveness to counter deepfakes and spoofing. Digital Intelligence adds device telemetry, geolocation, behavioral analytics, and anomaly detection, while guardian consent and householding connect devices within a home to streamline parental approvals and surface suspicious account clusters.

The outcome is risk-based age assurance tuned to interaction type and jurisdiction. Platforms gain verifiable controls that adapt in real time, preserve seamless experiences for legitimate users, and meet the expectations of regulators and families.

Responsible age assurance is not a single gate. It is an adaptive system informed by evidence, context, and policy. The platforms that embrace this model will set a safer, more trusted standard for conversational AI.

Meet Jonas. Cuadrado: a woodworker, family man, problem solver, and fraud fighting Data Science Senior Manager at Socure. 

Every day, Jonas hunts for signals hiding in billions of interactions and untangles the mysteries of thin digital footprints, always asking: "How can we make identity verification stronger, smarter, and more inclusive?â€

Jonas has spent the past three years tackling one of digital identityâ€™s toughest challenges: verifying individuals with light or new digital footprints. Recently, a breach of the Tea app exposed nearly 72,000 user-uploaded images, including government IDs and verification selfies.

The impact of this event goes far beyond the initial incident. Every leaked image now creates ongoing opportunities for fraudsters to impersonate real people or slip past outdated verification systems that still rely on basic image checks.

Tea is a platform where users, primarily women, share their dating experiences to help others stay safe. The app itself was built with safety in mind and even took the extra step of verifying contributors. This is a noble approach that goes above and beyond the security measures of most social platforms.

Letâ€™s be clear: this breach is not an indictment of the Tea app. What it does illuminate is the importance of using smarter, more layered identity verification systems that are built to handle the nuances of modern threats.

The big takeaway here is that static images, like the ones leaked from this breach, are no longer sufficient for identity verification. Once compromised, they can be used to impersonate real people, create AI-generated deepfakes, or access accounts on systems that lack proper defenses.

Socureâ€™s identity solutions prevent exactly this type of exploitation by verifying not just what was submitted, but how, when, and by whom. Our Predictive DocV combines document and biometric analysis with device and behavioral signals to ensure that identity is confirmed with context and intelligence, not just a photo.

This layered approach helps prevent sophisticated third-party fraud against images obtained from large-scale breaches. This is why major social apps and leading platforms across industries are leveraging Socure to prevent fraudulent access.

Read the full story below, and reach out to us for a demo of our DocV solution if you want to see the future of identity verification in action.

Last week, Socure broke new ground by hosting our first ever company-wide AI Hackathon, opening the doors to team members from every department to build and innovate with AI.

Whether in HR, operations, marketing, sales, or engineering, everyone was invited to collaborate and contribute.

The most exciting part? Over half of the participating teams came from non-engineering backgrounds.

This underscores the incredible potential we unlock when everyone has the tools and opportunity to innovate. Teams that typically don't code were training AI models and building applications, dramatically transforming how we approach challenges and reimagine our daily work.

The outcomes of this AI Hackathon exceeded expectations and demonstrated the momentum we harness as a team when AI-powered collaboration and creativity is encouraged company-wide. Stay tuned for more information about the winning projects, coming soon!

Weâ€™re proud to share that Socure has been named a winner of the 2025 MeridianLink Customer Choice Awards for our leadership in fraud prevention and identity verification.

This recognition reflects our commitment to delivering secure, reliable, and forward-thinking identity solutions that enable our customers to accelerate growth and unlock new revenue opportunities by verifying more good users. 

This award is based on direct customer feedback, which highlighted our strong integration, deep expertise, and the real-world impact of our solutions:

â€œSocure provided us with exemplary service through their cutting-edge identity verification and fraud prevention solutions, enhancing our security, streamlining operations, and delivering a seamless customer experience with unmatched expertise and support.â€

Thank you to MeridianLink and our customers for this recognition. We remain focused on building the future of identity with trust, innovation, and results.

Authentication should be seamless, precise, and built to eliminate risk without introducing friction.

This is exactly what Socure's Silent Network Authentication (SNA) and One-Time Password (OTP) solutions are purpose-built to deliver.

Both capabilities are natively embedded within RiskOSâ„¢ and powered by Socureâ€™s industry-leading Identity Graph. Each authentication signal â€” such as phone tenure, SIM swap status, device fingerprint, and IP geolocation â€” is analyzed in real time through a unified, hyperaccurate AI-driven decisioning engine.

SNA is uniquely resilient to fraud because it silently verifies device ownership over the mobile network. It does not rely on codes or user interaction, making it nearly impossible for bad actors to intercept or spoof.

Together, SNA and OTP transform authentication from a disjointed checkpoint into a unified, multi-signal layer of trust that protects the entire user journey. This includes everything from logins and profile updates to high-risk transactions.

This is next-generation authentication: silent, accurate, scalable, and designed to reduce drop-offs and false declines while maximizing user trust.
